definitions: not permitted by rules, laws, or accepted standards of behavior
contrary to moral principles and therefore unable to be accepted
examples: Such impermissible conduct will result in immediate termination
The judge ruled that the evidence was impermissible in court
Society considers such treatment of children completely impermissible
These impermissible actions violate our fundamental ethical principles

definitions: lacking human warmth, friendliness, or individual attention and care
not influenced by, showing, or involving personal feelings or considerations
examples: The hospital had an impersonal atmosphere that frightened patients
His impersonal manner made clients feel unwelcome
The letter contained only impersonal business information
She kept the conversation strictly impersonal and professional

definitions: not allowing fluid to pass through; unable to be penetrated physically
unable to be affected or influenced by something, especially criticism
examples: The impervious material keeps the rain from seeping through
These impervious containers protect sensitive electronic equipment
He seemed impervious to their harsh criticism
The politician remained impervious to public pressure

definitions: acting or done quickly and without thought or care; impulsive and rash
examples: His impetuous decision to quit cost him dearly
The impetuous young man rushed into danger without thinking
Her impetuous nature often led to regrettable mistakes
They made an impetuous purchase they couldn't afford

definitions: unable to be appeased, placated, or satisfied; relentlessly hostile or determined
examples: She faced an implacable enemy who would never forgive
His implacable opposition to the proposal never wavered
The implacable force of nature destroyed everything in its path
Their implacable hatred lasted for generations

definitions: inserted or embedded surgically into body tissue or an organ
firmly fixed or established in someone's mind, memory, or consciousness
examples: The implanted device monitors his heart rhythm continuously
She received an implanted hearing aid last month
These deeply implanted beliefs shaped his entire worldview
The implanted memories seemed completely real to him

definitions: not seeming reasonable or probable; difficult or impossible to believe
examples: His implausible excuse failed to convince the teacher
The movie's implausible plot ruined the viewing experience
She told an implausible story about meeting the president
Their implausible alibi quickly fell apart under questioning

definitions: put into effect or action according to a plan or system
examples: The newly implemented policy affects all employees
They implemented changes based on customer feedback
The implemented software solution improved efficiency significantly
Our implemented strategy yielded positive results

definitions: shown to be involved in something illegal or morally wrong
examples: Several officials were implicated in the corruption scandal
The implicated parties denied all wrongdoing
Evidence implicated him in the robbery
She was implicated by witness testimony

definitions: implied though not directly expressed; understood without being openly stated
complete and unquestioning; having no doubts or reservations
examples: There was an implicit understanding between the partners
The implicit message was clear to everyone present
She had implicit faith in her doctor's judgment
His implicit trust in the system proved misguided

definitions: making an earnest or desperate appeal; begging someone to do something
examples: Her imploring eyes begged him to reconsider
He spoke in an imploring tone that moved everyone
The imploring letter asked for immediate assistance
She made an imploring gesture with outstretched hands

definitions: of great significance, value, or consequence; having a major effect or influence
having high rank, status, or authority; influential and powerful
examples: This important decision will affect thousands of people
She made several important contributions to science
He was an important figure in the government
The important guests arrived in luxury vehicles

definitions: brought into a country from abroad for sale or use
examples: The store sells imported wines from France
These imported goods cost more than domestic products
She drives an imported luxury car
The imported materials arrive by container ship

definitions: forced on someone or something; established or applied by authority
examples: The imposed sanctions crippled the country's economy
These imposed restrictions limit our freedom
The imposed deadline gave them only two weeks
Parents resented the imposed curriculum changes

definitions: grand and impressive in appearance, manner, or size; commanding respect
examples: The imposing cathedral dominated the city skyline
His imposing presence commanded immediate attention
She lived in an imposing mansion on the hill
The imposing mountains stretched endlessly before them

definitions: not able to occur, exist, or be done; beyond the realm of possibility
very difficult to deal with or extremely unreasonable
examples: Time travel remains impossible with current technology
It's impossible to be in two places simultaneously
He's impossible to work with when he's angry
This impossible situation requires a creative solution

definitions: lacking power, strength, or ability to influence or control events
unable to achieve or maintain an erection for sexual intercourse
examples: They felt impotent against the massive corporation
The government seemed impotent to stop the crisis
The medication can cause men to become impotent
He sought treatment for being impotent

definitions: reduced to poverty; having very little money or few possessions
lacking in quality, substance, or interest; made inferior or weakened
examples: The impoverished family struggled to buy food
Many impoverished nations depend on foreign aid
His impoverished imagination produced boring stories
The impoverished soil couldn't support healthy crops

definitions: impossible to put into practice or accomplish; not feasible or workable
examples: The proposed solution proved impracticable given our resources
Such impracticable ideas waste everyone's time
Building there is impracticable due to the terrain
Their impracticable demands stalled the negotiations

definitions: not sensible, realistic, or able to be done effectively; lacking practical sense
examples: Her impractical shoes made walking difficult
That's an impractical solution to our problem
He's brilliant but impractical in everyday matters
The impractical design looked beautiful but didn't function

definitions: devoted to the pursuit of sensual pleasure, especially good food and comfort
relating to the ancient Greek philosopher Epicurus or his philosophy
examples: His epicurean tastes led him to exclusive restaurants
She lived an epicurean lifestyle of luxury
The epicurean philosophy emphasized happiness through moderation
These epicurean teachings influenced later thinkers

definitions: relating to or governed by bishops; of or relating to the Episcopal Church
examples: The episcopal authority governed the regional churches
He wore traditional episcopal vestments
The episcopal diocese covered three counties
She attended the episcopal conference

definitions: relating to or denoting the Episcopal Church or its members
examples: The episcopalian congregation gathered for Sunday service
Her episcopalian faith shaped her worldview
They followed episcopalian traditions in the ceremony
The episcopalian minister delivered a moving sermon

definitions: relating to Eritrea, its people, culture, or language
examples: The Eritrean cuisine features spicy meat dishes
She studied Eritrean history at university
Eritrean refugees sought asylum in neighboring countries
The Eritrean flag has green, red and blue

definitions: relating to Estonia, its people, culture, or language
examples: Estonian folklore includes many ancient legends
She learned Estonian to communicate with relatives
The Estonian economy has grown rapidly
Estonian winters can be extremely cold

definitions: relating to Ethiopia, its people, culture, or language
examples: Ethiopian coffee is renowned worldwide
The Ethiopian highlands have unique wildlife
She wore traditional Ethiopian dress to the festival
Ethiopian runners dominate long-distance events

definitions: relating to the Christian ceremony commemorating the Last Supper; of Holy Communion
examples: The eucharistic service takes place every Sunday
They prepared the eucharistic elements before mass
Eucharistic theology differs among Christian denominations
The priest led the eucharistic prayer

definitions: relating to the combined continental landmass of Europe and Asia or its peoples
examples: The Eurasian continent spans from Portugal to Japan
Eurasian trade routes connected ancient civilizations
Many Eurasian species migrate vast distances
The Eurasian steppe supported nomadic cultures

definitions: focusing on European culture or history to the exclusion of other cultures
examples: Critics argued the curriculum was too eurocentric
His eurocentric worldview ignored Asian contributions
The eurocentric narrative overlooked African achievements
Museums are moving away from eurocentric displays

definitions: relating to Europe, its peoples, cultures, or languages
examples: European history spans thousands of years
She took a European vacation last summer
The European Union promotes economic cooperation
European cuisine varies greatly by region

definitions: denoting a scale of temperature where water freezes at 32 degrees and boils at 212
examples: The temperature reached ninety degrees fahrenheit today
Convert the fahrenheit reading to celsius
American recipes use fahrenheit oven temperatures
The fahrenheit scale is standard in the US

definitions: relating to the central government rather than regional or local governments
relating to a system where states unite under a central authority while maintaining independence
examples: Federal law supersedes state regulations
She works for a federal agency
The federal system balances state and national power
Federal elections occur every four years

definitions: relating to Fiji, its people, culture, or languages
examples: Fijian hospitality makes visitors feel welcome
The Fijian rugby team competed internationally
She learned traditional Fijian dances
Fijian waters contain spectacular coral reefs

definitions: lacking exactness and accuracy of expression, measurement, or detail
examples: His imprecise directions got us completely lost
The imprecise measurements ruined the experiment
She gave an imprecise answer to avoid commitment
Their imprecise language created confusion

definitions: unable to be captured or broken into; totally secure against attack
unable to be successfully challenged, questioned, or defeated
examples: The impregnable fortress withstood every siege
Their impregnable defense system protected vital data
She built an impregnable legal case
His impregnable logic convinced all skeptics

definitions: feeling or showing admiration or respect for someone or something
examples: The judges were deeply impressed by her performance
I'm impressed with your dedication to this project
He wasn't impressed by their expensive car
She seemed genuinely impressed by the results

definitions: easily influenced because of a lack of critical judgment or experience
examples: Young children are highly impressionable
The impressionable teenager copied her favorite celebrity
His impressionable nature made him vulnerable to manipulation
Impressionable minds need careful guidance

definitions: relating to impressionism, an art movement emphasizing light and color over detail
examples: The impressionist paintings captured fleeting moments
Monet's impressionist style influenced many artists
The gallery featured impressionist works from France
Her impressionist technique uses bold brushstrokes

definitions: based on subjective impressions rather than systematic analysis or facts
giving a general impression without detail; subjective and unsystematic
examples: Her impressionistic account lacked concrete details
The impressionistic study relied on personal observations
He painted in an impressionistic style
The impressionistic description evoked the mood perfectly

definitions: evoking admiration through size, quality, skill, or excellence; remarkable and admirable
examples: Her impressive achievements earned international recognition
The impressive building dominated the city skyline
He gave an impressive performance at the concert
Their impressive collection includes rare artifacts

definitions: confined in prison as punishment for a crime or while awaiting trial
examples: The imprisoned activists went on hunger strike
He was imprisoned for five years
The imprisoned journalist continued writing from her cell
Many imprisoned people maintain their innocence

definitions: not likely to be true or to happen; having a low probability
unexpected and apparently inauthentic; difficult to believe
examples: An improbable series of events led to their meeting
Success seemed improbable given the circumstances
The movie featured an improbable hero
Her improbable excuse raised suspicions

definitions: done without being planned, organized, or rehearsed; spontaneous and unrehearsed
examples: She gave an impromptu speech at the wedding
They organized an impromptu celebration
The impromptu performance delighted the audience
He made an impromptu decision to visit

definitions: not in accordance with accepted standards, especially of morality or behavior
not in accordance with rules or formal standards; wrong or incorrect
examples: His improper conduct led to immediate dismissal
Such improper behavior won't be tolerated
The improper installation caused the system failure
Using improper grammar affects your credibility

definitions: made better in quality, condition, or capability than before
examples: The improved version fixes all known bugs
Her improved health allowed her to travel
Students showed improved test scores this year
The improved recipe tastes much better

definitions: becoming better in quality, condition, or degree; showing positive progress
examples: The improving economy boosted consumer confidence
Her improving skills impressed the coach
Patient shows improving vital signs
The improving weather allowed outdoor activities

definitions: created and performed spontaneously without preparation or script
created from whatever materials are available; makeshift or temporary
examples: The actor's improvised dialogue was brilliantly funny
They performed an improvised jazz session
Soldiers built improvised shelters from debris
The improvised explosive device was defused

definitions: acting or done suddenly without thinking carefully about the consequences
examples: Her impulsive purchases often exceeded her budget
The impulsive decision changed his entire life
He's too impulsive to be a good leader
Impulsive behavior can damage relationships

definitions: mixed with foreign matter; contaminated or adulterated with unwanted substances
morally wrong, especially relating to sexual matters; not chaste or virtuous
examples: The impure water caused widespread illness
Impure metals affect the product quality
Medieval texts condemned impure thoughts
They believed impure actions brought divine punishment

definitions: unable to be reached, entered, or approached due to physical barriers or distance
difficult to understand, appreciate, or relate to; beyond ordinary comprehension
examples: The mountain village remains inaccessible during winter
Important files were inaccessible after the crash
His inaccessible writing style alienated readers
The professor's lectures were inaccessible to beginners
